content: I'd like to mark a version of a module as unsupported and remove its listing on BackdropCMS.org -- how can I do that? e.g. I've just released a 1.x-2.x version and want to remove the 1.x-1.x version. I also need to remove the 1.x page from borg because the module name changed and I want the old one out of sight.
I could do this. I assume you don't have permission? What module?
Thanks @Herb -- I don't think I have access. This one should be removed completely: https://backdropcms.org/project/stripe_api
(This is the replacement: https://backdropcms.org/project/stripe and it looks okay on borg)
Can I just delete the 1.x-1.x release on github? Or is there a way to mark it as unsupported?
Actually this one should be removed as well: https://backdropcms.org/project/stripe_checkout
I asked about this once before and I think that we do have preferred process for marking a module "unsupported," but I don't remember what it is.
This should be documented somewhere.
I hope that we always leave some information about what happened to a module that is no longer supported. It shouldn't just disappear, should it?
I've deleted the release and marked the project as unsupported. @Laryn you can delete the release and tag in github.

I have a site that was using the Beta release of the Group module . I recently noticed that it's no longer supported and I got a big red message on the status page.(Drupal 7 - they still support Drupal 8)
Available_updates___Silicon_Prairie_Portal_and_Exchange.png
It's probably related to the security release that came out today.
I suspect that will happen more and more as contrib maintainers decide they no longer want to maintain the 7.x branches of their projects.
This is going to be a problem for me. This site is making significant use of Group module.
Over 700 sites are using this module (Group for D7) and I can't find any statement or information about why they discontinued support or if there are known security issues.
Maybe it would be worth it to submit an issue asking about it.
It doesn't look like the D7 branch has been actively maintained in quite a while.
@StPaulTim Have a look at the 8.x-1.0 release notes: https://www.drupal.org/project/group/releases/8.x-1.0
Thanks. That's all I was looking for. Not easy to find, if you are not using Drupal 8 version of the module. :-)
